sentence.Network_en: He looked unshaven, shabby, and down-and-out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看上去胡子拉碴、衣衫褴褛、穷困潦倒。

sentence.Network_en: a novel about being down and out in London
sentence.Network_cn: 一部以伦敦的流浪生活为题材的小说

sentence.Network_en: Once a very rich man, he is now down and out and must depend upon his friends for help.
sentence.Network_cn: 他曾是一个很富的人, 现在完全潦倒了,必须靠朋友周济.

entry.tran: 穷困潦倒的;无家可归的
entry.def: If you describe someone as down-and-out, you mean that they have no job and nowhere to live, and they have no real hope of improving their situation.

example.ex: ...a short story about a down-and-out advertising copywriter...
example.tran: 关于一个穷困潦倒的广告文案的短篇故事

example.ex: He looked unshaven, shabby, and down-and-out.
example.tran: 他看上去胡子拉碴、衣衫褴褛、穷困潦倒。

means.word_mean: 1. lacking resources (or any prospect of resources)
